content: Define the module TopModule with inputs a, b, c, d and output out.
source: I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified. - input  a - input  b - input  c - input  d - output out

content: Implement the logic for the output 'out' based on the Karnaugh map for the case (c,d) = (0,0).
source: The module should implement the Karnaugh map below. d is don't-care. The output out is 1'bx for don't-care case. c,d  0,0 | d | 0 | 1 | 1 |

content: Implement the logic for the output 'out' based on the Karnaugh map for the case (c,d) = (0,1).
source: The module should implement the Karnaugh map below. d is don't-care. The output out is 1'bx for don't-care case. c,d  0,1 | 0 | 0 | d | d |

content: Implement the logic for the output 'out' based on the Karnaugh map for the case (c,d) = (1,1).
source: The module should implement the Karnaugh map below. d is don't-care. The output out is 1'bx for don't-care case. c,d  1,1 | 0 | 1 | 1 | 1 |

content: Implement the logic for the output 'out' based on the Karnaugh map for the case (c,d) = (1,0).
source: The module should implement the Karnaugh map below. d is don't-care. The output out is 1'bx for don't-care case. c,d  1,0 | 0 | 1 | 1 | 1 |
